snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said changes made by General Motors “should address the issue” of fire risks in the Chevrolet Volt, but that its investigation remained open.
abstract: General Motors says it will upgrade the steel structure and liquid cooling system that surround the battery in its Chevrolet Volt to address concerns that the car could catch fire after a severe crash; National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is satisfied with proposed changes, but its investigation remains open.
lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said changes made by General Motors “should address the issue” of fire risks in the Chevrolet Volt, but that its investigation remained open.

headline.seo: G.M. to Reinforce Battery in Chevrolet Volt, a Hybrid
headline.main: G.M. to Reinforce Battery in Its Hybrid Car, the Volt
headline.print_headline: G.M. to Reinforce Battery In Its Hybrid Car, the Volt
